teaser: This cinnamon toast with raspberries recipe makes a delicious breakfast or brunch to serve to family and friends overt the Easter weekend. We have served this with raspberries but you can serve with any fresh fruit you like - blueberries, bananas or strawberries, or just drizzle with chocolate spread. This is a great way to use up leftover stale bread, and a good way to get the kids to enjoy more milk and eggs in their diet, they can even make this themselves  its a great way to feed starving children who have been for a sleepover too!
title: Cinnamon toast with raspberries

teaser: Quick and so easy to make, warm muffins are ideal for a mid-morning sweet treat with a cup of coffee. This recipe needs really ripe bananas  the riper the better as the flesh will be easier to mash and is packed full of sweetness and flavour. Muffins are best eaten on the day of making but they freeze well too, allow them to cool completely then pop in a freezer bag and freeze for up to 2 months. Defrost at room temperature for about 2 hours and if you want them warm simply reheat in a low oven for 5-10 mins.
title: Banana muffins

teaser: A classic American pastry tart filled with a buttery syrup and packed with pecan nuts, this dessert is traditionally served for Thanksgiving. The pecan pie is delicious served with vanilla ice cream or clotted cream. You could also make individual tarts if liked, just cook them a little less and you could use half maple syrup and half golden syrup
title: Pecan pie

teaser: These pastries are made using ready-made croissant dough. Quick and simple, filled with apple, sultanas, honey and spice, like traditional Danish pastries. Great for breakfast or a tea time treat
title: Quick apple croissants

teaser: A quick and easy cherry tart made using frozen fruits so you can enjoy this creamy recipe for dessert all year round
title: Fruity tart

teaser: This gooey and delicious Creme Egg milkshake is super easy to make and tastes as good as it looks. You dont need much to make this treat, just 1 Creme Egg, some ice cream and milk and youre ready to go. Its a cheap, quick and easy treat come Easter Sunday that the kids can enjoy for dessert. Top with half a Creme Egg or even grate some chocolate over the top of the foamy whipped cream topping for a posh finish. Chocolate ice cream would work just as well in this recipe as an extra chocolaty milkshake twist.
title: Creme Egg milkshake

teaser: Using a classic brownie recipe, these gooey and soft brownies are transformed into an Easter favourite. Topped with melting Creme Eggs and soft Mini Eggs, this tasty tray bake would be ideal for sharing this Easter. The kids are just going to love the chocolaty goodness in each bite. The Creme Eggs and Mini Eggs are added to the brownie mix 5 mins before its cooked which means that the eggs will be warm and gooey inside. Serve with ice cream for dessert or have with a warm cuppa when the family are round. Make sure you line your tin with greaseproof paper before baking some theres no chance that your brownie will burn.
title: Easter egg brownies

teaser: Whip up these easy little brownies in no-time. Don't be scared by the mayonnaise in the ingredients, it works the same way as butter
title: Posh brownies

teaser: Looking to add a little extra fruit to your sweet treats? Why not try a rich apple and toffee sauce with brownies, they make a winning combination
title: Bramley, chocolate & pecan brownies

teaser: The blackberries in this chocolate slice make a fantastic gooey centre. A great way to use up any blackberries you might have!
title: Ed Baines' chocolate and blackberry slice

teaser: Treat yourself to an indulgent chocolate snack with this brownies recipe. For a healthy option use low-calorie sugar to keep the calorie count down
title: Chocolate rum and raisin brownies

teaser: Quick and easy, these simple apple flapjacks make a great breakfast or energy-boosting snack for your family for a whole week.
title: Apple flapjacks

teaser: Transform ordinary biscuits and ice cream quickly and easily into a treat dessert lovers of all ages will enjoy - ready in just 10 mins
title: Chocolate and coconut ice cream sandwiches

teaser: Give your porridge a great winter kick with this simple recipe. Cranberries and mixed spice add a nice flavour to the dish - which will keep you full until lunch
title: Cranberry spice porridge

teaser: These oat slices are delicious, using fruit compote to provide the sweetness instead of too much sugar.
title: Berry cake bars

teaser: Great for Easter Sunday tea - rather than a traditional Simnel cake, this version uses fresh raspberries, sliced pears and a little diced marzipan for that traditional flavour.
title: Pear and raspberry cake

teaser: These dainty little cakes are crisp on the outside with a soft chewy macaroon centre. Fresh raspberries are pressed into them just before baking
title: Coconut raspberry friands

teaser: This scrumptious tart is made from the winning combination of juicy peaches and ground almonds.
title: Peach and almond tart

teaser: This deliciously moist orange and almond cake requires just six ingredients. It contains no flour, but polenta instead, so it's gluten-free
title: Luxury orange and almond polenta cake

teaser: The ingredients in this rich and delicious cake are good for your complexion, digestion and overall wellbeing.
title: Orange, honey and almond cake

teaser: These indulgent tartlets, packed with cherry preserve and light almonds, have far fewer calories than shop-bought versions.
title: Almond tartlets

teaser:
An autumnal version of a classic, much loved dessert - bread and butter pudding. The brioche loaf, 
made with eggs and butter, gives this pudding an extra richness.
title: Blackberry and almond bread and butter pudding

teaser: This delicious pudding is soft, moist and smouldered with sauce made from rum. Walnuts are added for texture. Serve the pudding warm and contrast it with ice cream.
title: Banana and raisin puddings with rum and walnut sauce

teaser: This tart is like a giant Danish pastry. It's great eaten cold with afternoon tea or warm with whipped cream, crème fraîche or ice cream
title: Figgy almond tart
